trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientViaBehavior"></xref> is used by clients to specify the URI for which the transport channel should be created.

If such a behavior exists in the behavior collection on a client endpoint, the transport uses the URI that it provides, while all the other channel layers in the stack use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> provided at <xref:System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory> construction time.
This <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> also becomes the WS-Addressing `To` header.

Use this behavior when the immediate network destination is not the intended processor of the message to enable multiple-hop conversations when the calling application does not necessarily know the ultimate destination or when the destination `Via` header is not an address.
You can also set this value using the [\<clientVia\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/clientvia.md) element in a client application configuration file.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientViaBehavior"></xref> class.
The URI for which the transport channel should be created.
Gets or set the URI for which the transport channel should be created.
You can also set this value using the [\<clientVia\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/clientvia.md) element in a client application configuration file.
The URI for which the transport channel should be created.
Is not implemented.
The service endpoint.
The binding parameters to be applied to the service endpoint.
Sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime.Via"></xref> to the URI for which the transport channel is created.
The service endpoint.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime"></xref> for which the client behavior is to be applied.
Implements a modification or extension of the service across an endpoint.
Throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> because this operation should not be performed at the client end.
The service endpoint that exposes the contract.
The endpoint dispatcher to be modified.
Is not implemented.
The service endpoint that exposes the contract.
